array.name: learning_center_content
array.item: Actinic Keatoses and Intraepithelial Carcinoma (Bowen\'s Disease)

resources.string: Please make sure image of the lesion are filled up to 80% of the image. The analysis will be provided based on the datasets we used.
Nothings are found. Seems nothing to worry about your skin.

BCCs (Basal Cell Carcinomas) are kinds of skin cancer that arises in the skin\'s basal cells, which line the deepest layer of the epidermis. The BCCs often look like open sores, red patches, pink growths, shiny bumps, or scars and are usually caused by a combination of cumulative and intense, occasional sun exposure. The prognosis for patients with BCC is excellent, but if the disease is allowed to progress, it can cause significant morbidity.
